body_html:
This doesn't seem quite right to me. Why should the analogy function sometimes return a string, but sometimes print a string and then return nothing? That is a strange contract for a function, and will confuse users of this code who are depending on the return value (i.e. not in interactive mode).

Instead of changing the type signature of the function, can you instead make it handle unicode correctly?
body_text:

Instead of changing the type signature of the function, can you instead make it handle unicode correctly?
body:
This doesn't seem quite right to me. Why should the analogy function sometimes return a string, but sometimes print a string and then return nothing? That is a strange contract for a function, and will confuse users of this code who are depending on the return value (i.e. not in interactive mode).

Instead of changing the type signature of the function, can you instead make it handle unicode correctly?
